data.title: Bowling Green State University
data.meta_description: Tyler Ross (18) INF - Years of Remaining Eligibility including 2023-24: 1 Career Highlights 2024 Second-Team All-MAC (SS) 2024 CSC Academic All-District Team...
data.text:
Years of Remaining Eligibility including 2023-24: 1

Career Highlights

2024 Second-Team All-MAC (SS)

2024 CSC Academic All-District Team

Two-Time MAC Player of the Week (March 11, 2024; March 25, 2024)

Four-Time Academic All-MAC (2021, 2022, 2023, 2024)

2024

Played in 44 games with 43 starts for the Falcons

Recorded 16 total bases against Miami (OH) (March 8), tying Andy Tracy’s single-game program record set on May 10, 1995

Logged a pair of triples in against Akron (March 23), tying the program record for triples in a game, the 10th player to do it in program history

Finished the season with a career-best .331 batting average, third on the team and 14th in the MAC

Posted a career-best .563 slugging percentage, fourth on the team and 17th in the MAC

Ended the year with a .432 on-base percentage, ranking fifth on the team and 16th in the MAC

Scored a career-high 46 runs for the Falcons, ranking third on the team and 15th in the MAC

Recorded a team-high six sacrifice flies, tied for third in the MAC

Finished third on the team in doubles with a career-high 10

Set career-highs in hits (53), triples (3), home runs (7), RBI (37) and walks (24)

Registered 13 multi-hit games, including a season-high five against Miami (OH) (March 8)

Tallied nine multi-RBI games, including a season-high six against Miami (OH) (March 8)

Reached based in 21 straight games, the fifth-longest streak on the team

2023

Appeared in, and started, 46 of BGSU’s 50 games

Led the team and finished the regular season tied for 15th in the MAC in hit by pitch (10)

Ended the regular season second on the team and tied for eighth in the MAC in sacrifice bunts (5)

Recorded four sacrifice flies on the season, second on the team and tied for 11th in the conference at the end of the regular season

Put together a seven-game hitting streak (April 8-21)

Tied for third on the team in RBI with a career-high 30

Finished the season fourth on the team in batting average (.270) and doubles (7)

Concluded the season tied for fifth on the team in hits with a career-high 41

Tallied a season-high four hits against Northern Illinois (May 12)

Recorded a season-high six RBI in the season finale against Toledo (May 20), including a grand slam

Blasted a career-high four home runs with three of the coming against Toledo

Drew a career-high 22 walks while stealing a career-high seven bases

2022

Appeared in 44 games, making 37 starts

Hit for an average of .226

Had 31 hits and 18 RBI

Hit six doubles, one triple, and one home run

Drew six walks

Recorded 34 assists in the field

Began the season 2-for-4 with three runs, five RBI, and one home run against Saint Louis on February 18

Had an eight-game hit streak from 3/19-4/3 with three RBI and three doubles

Had a fielding percentage of .967

Went 3-for-5 with three runs and one RBI against Western Michigan on April 24

Tied for fourth in the MAC for RBI in one game with five against Saint Louis on February 18

2021

Appeared in 26 games, making 24 starts

Hit .305 on the season

Recorded 25 hits

Drove home nine runs

Scored 25 runs

Recorded a .415 slugging percentage

Posted a .431 on-base percentage

Went 3-for-5 with two runs, two RBI and a double on March 5 at James Madison

Eight-game hitting streak from February 28- March 14

Over this streak, racked up 13 hits, six RBI, and eight runs

Hit his only home run of the season at Ohio on March 21

2020

Appeared in 10 games for the Falcons

Made six starts

Scored one run and recorded two RBI

HIGH SCHOOL

A 2019 graduate of Olentangy Orange High School

Three-year letterwinner for coaches Phil Callaghan and Tom Marker

Named honorable mention all-state

Named a team captain

Played travel ball for TCR

Member of National Honors Society

PERSONAL

Full name is Tyler Jeffrey Ross

Son of Mike and Marcy Ross

Has one younger sister, Sidney

Favorite athlete is Francisco Lindor
